isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS DT 466 and DT 530 - HARD START / NO START DIAGNOSTICS - EST Data List

entry.para: Do tests 10, 11, 12 if EST is not available.
• Enter data in the Actual column below.
• Monitor DATA for 20 seconds or more while cranking engine.
• If voltage is low, see ECM Diagnostics.
• If no rpm is noted, check DTC's.
• If ICP is low, do Test 13.

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To determine if systems needed for starting meet operating specifications.

svcsubproc.title: Test Procedure

para.emph: Test must be done with fully charged batteries.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, do not under any circumstances allow smoking, an electric spark or open flame near the battery or explosion may occur.
To avoid personal injury, be certain that the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is applied, and drive wheels are blocked prior to cranking engine.

svcsubproc.para: To measure battery voltage, engine cranking rpm, and Injection Control Pressure (ICP), read Electronic Service Tool (EST) data, while cranking the engine for a minimum of 20 seconds.
If an EST is not available, use a Digital Multimeter (DMM) as an alternative to perform the following tests:

Connect the EST tool to the American Trucking Association (ATA) diagnostic connector. The connector is on the underside of the dash panel (left side) inside the cab in most applications. Use Master Diagnostics to view Battery Voltage, Engine rpm, and ICP pressure while cranking .

step1.para: Crank the engine and read data on the screen. The data will be displayed when the engine begins to crank. The battery voltage must be 7 or more volts.
If voltage to the Electronic Control Module (ECM) drops below 7 volts, the ECM will not remain powered up. If the ECM does not get power through the ECM relay, the engine will not start.

Engine cranking speed must generate the required ICP to operate the fuel injectors and create the required compression to ignite the fuel. If the EST shows 0 rpm during engine cranking, the ECM may not be receiving a signal from the Camshaft Position (CMP) sensor.
If the CMP sensor is not functioning, it must be replaced. The ECM will not allow the Injector Pressure Regulator (IPR) valve to fully activate without a CMP signal.

If the EST indicates low or no injection control pressure, check oil level in oil reservoir (on front cover). Remove the engine harness connector from the Engine Oil Temperature (EOT) sensor. Remove the EOT sensor from the front cover. Oil should drain from the internal reservoir. If oil does not drain from the sensor hole continue to crank the engine.

note.para: Proceed with caution when removing sensor. Do not completely remove if oil is present.

step1.para: If the oil reservoir level continues to fall, the primary lube oil pump may be inadequate in its duty to supply oil to the reservoir. See Low ICP Pressure Test 13 .

item.para: Low battery voltage - Failed batteries, high resistance at battery cable connections, or in wiring to the ECM.
Blown 40A in-line fuse (in battery box) which supplies voltage to the ECM
Low cranking rpm - Can be caused by electrical system malfunctions, incorrect oil viscosity, or long oil change intervals in cold ambient temperatures.

No engine rpm indication on EST while cranking the engine. - This can be caused by a faulty CMP sensor or faulty circuitry to the ECM. Recheck for DTC's after cranking engine. See EST, Diagnostic Trouble Codes or Diagnostic Trouble Code Access (DTC) .
Low ICP Pressure - This could indicate a leak in the high pressure oil system or a defective ICP sensor.
A defective high pressure oil pump, pump drive, defective Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR), or electronic controls for the regulator could also cause low injection control pressure.

svcsubproc.title: Tools Required
svcsubproc.para: Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics software

item.para: If DTC's are set, see DTC column on Engine Diagnostic Trouble Codes .

para.emph: To troubleshoot low voltage at ECM Power Supply see:

item.para: Electronic Control Module Power Supply Diagram
Electronic Control Module Power Supply Circuit

para.emph: No engine rpm indication during cranking - See CMP sensor diagnostics

item.para: Camshaft Position Sensor and Circuit Diagnostics

para.emph: No Injection Control Pressure - See Injection Control Pressure (ICP) sensor diagnostics

item.para: ICP Sensor Circuit Diagram Using a Breakout Tee

para.emph: No or low injection control pressure and no electronic DTC's

item.para: See Test 13 - Low ICP Pressure Test
